snippet: Syria held parliamentary elections on Monday, which the government billed as a step toward reform and the opposition dismissed as a farce that ignored demands for real political change.
abstract: Syrian government holds parliamentary elections, calling them an important step toward reform, while virtually ignoring public demands for sweeping democratic change that have rocked the country for 14 months; opposition calls the elections a sham.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Syria held parliamentary elections on Monday, which the government billed as a step toward reform and the opposition dismissed as a farce that ignored demands for real political change.

headline.main: Syrians Vote in Election Dismissed by Foes as a Farce
headline.print_headline: Syrians Vote in Election Dismissed by Foes as a Farce

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
